alert.note: Alert for Northern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 2:18PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lake County through 245 PM EDT... At 217 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Eustis, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph and up to penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eustis, Mount Dora, Paisley, Cassia and DeBary. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
